This is how the Armenians are in their parliament. Having problematic issues of the very existence of the state, they considered it obligatory to speak out, albeit inappropriately.

They say that they were “drawn” into “another system” (meaning the EAEU), but in fact “Armenia is the bearer of the European democratic system,” therefore obtaining the status of a candidate for membership in the European Union for their country is both correct and desirable.

description: A survey by Kantar Emor revealed a decline in public trust in the Estonian government, with the average trust level in all ministers dropping from 21% to 17%. The most trusted ministers were Hanno Pevkur (30%), Christina Callas (26%), and Kaja Kallas (21%).
original:
Forwarded from: SAEAS FOCUS
Kantar Emor: Estonian residents trust ministers less and less. The sociological company “Kantar Emor” measured the level of public trust in the government in Estonia. The results were presented at a press conference by the head of the study, Aivar Voog. He pointed out that in March the average level of trust in all Estonian ministers fell from 21% to 17%.

The head of the Ministry of Armor, Hanno Pevkur, took first place in the rating of trust in government politicians; 30% of Estonian residents trust him. Following him is Education Minister Christina Callas, who has 26%. The head of government, Kaja Kallas, is trusted by 21% of respondents.

Next in the trust rating are Interior Minister Lauri Läänemets and Health Minister Riina Sikkut (both 20%), Foreign Minister Margus Tsahkna and Culture Minister Heidi Purga (both 18%), and Climate Minister Kristen Michal (17%). ). Former Justice Minister Kalle Laanet (officially resigning on March 25) and regional minister Madis Kallas are trusted by 13%, and Social Security Minister Signe Riisalo by 10% of Estonian residents. The least trusted by the population are still Minister of Economy and Information Technology Tiit Riisalo (8%) and Minister of Finance Marta Vyrklaev (7%). The data is based on an online survey conducted by Kantar Emor in Estonia using a representative sample. From 14 to 20 March 2024, 1215 Estonian residents aged 16+ were surveyed.#ESTONIA#KANTAR_EMOR

description: The SBU detained an FSB agent who was directing Russian aerial bombs at Sumy Oblast. The agent, a local resident and ideological supporter of racism, was recruited by the FSB after expressing anti-Ukrainian narratives on Russian social networks. She was tasked with tracking Ukrainian troop locations, marking coordinates, and sending reports to the occupiers.
original:
The SBU detained an FSB agent who was directing Russian aerial bombs at Sumy Oblast.

As a result of comprehensive measures, an FSB agent was detained, who was preparing a series of airstrikes in the region, including with the use of guided aerial bombs.

The main targets of the enemy were the defense positions of the Armed Forces in a 5-kilometer zone near the state border of Ukraine.

In order to complete the task, the defendant had to track down the locations of Ukrainian troops, mark their coordinates on the map and send a corresponding "report" to the occupiers.

First of all, it tried to identify strongholds and establish the location of units of the Defense Forces.

To do this, the Russian agent, under the guise of an ordinary citizen, went around the border area and secretly recorded "necessary" objects on the camera of her phone.

SBU employees documented the criminal actions of the suspect and arrested her "red-handed" when she tried to make a new reconnaissance foray.

At the same time, comprehensive measures were taken to ensure the personnel, weapons and ammunition of the Ukrainian troops in the region.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice turned out to be a local resident, an ideological supporter of racism. After the start of the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation, she expressed anti-Ukrainian narratives on Russian social networks.

In this way, she came to the attention of the FSB and was later recruited by the enemy special service.

At first, the traitor spied for the occupiers in the border area where she lived. But after he was fired with rockets, the woman and her fellow villagers were evacuated to another settlement in Sumy Oblast.

There, she registered as an immigrant and planned to collect intelligence on the Defense Forces on behalf of the FSB in the future.

Currently, the investigators of the Security Service have informed her of the suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

She faces life in prison.

description: Russia's Ministry of Defense has initiated the spring conscription campaign, taking into account past experiences and addressing key issues from the autumn campaign. Ukrainian propaganda is expected to spread misinformation, and citizens are advised to rely on verified sources. Conscripts will not be sent to conflict zones and will serve 12 months, with a focus on scientific and production units.
original: The spring conscription campaign begins in Russia. When preparing it, the Ministry of Defense took into account the experience of past years and the main problems of the autumn campaign. We warn that Ukrainian propaganda will not bypass the draft in the Russian Armed Forces and will intensively spread fakes on this topic. We publish basic information about the upcoming conscription and once again urge you to trust only verified sources and to be critical of incoming information. Military personnel undergoing military service under conscription will not be sent to the locations of units of the Russian Armed Forces in the DPR, LPR, Kherson and Zaporozhye regions and to participate in fulfilling the tasks of the Northern Military District. The spring conscription campaign will take place from April 1 in all constituent entities of the Russian Federation except for the regions of the Far North, where conscription takes place from May 1 due to climatic conditions. Conscripts will be sent to permanent deployment points on the territory of the Russian Federation except for new regions of the country. Beginning departures from assembly points are scheduled for April 15. The term of conscription service will continue to be 12 months. Military personnel who have served the established terms of conscription military service will be promptly discharged and sent to their places of residence. During conscription, special attention will again be paid to the recruitment of scientific and scientific-production units. A third of conscripts will be sent to training formations and military units, where up to five months will master modern military equipment and receive a military specialty. Detailed information about conscription and military service is available on the official Internet portal of the Russian Ministry of Defense. In the “Contacts” section, you can contact the electronic reception rooms of commanders-in-chief of branches, commanders of military branches and troops of military districts. On April 16, the General Staff will launch a “direct telephone line”, where specialists will provide clarifications on issues related to conscription. Subscribe to the “War on Fake” so as not to be deceived.

description: A terrorist attack occurred at Crocus, where Karen Yengibaryan rushed to save his best friend's mother. He helped victims, including giving his jacket to one of them, but later developed a severe cold and refused hospitalization. His condition worsened, and he eventually died from liver damage due to excessive paracetamol consumption.
original:
A 35-year-old man who came to Crocus to save his best friend’s mother died five days after the terrorist attack. Karen Yengibaryan (pictured 1) was not a spectator of the Picnic concert. He rushed to the scene of the terrorist attack immediately after a call from his friend Mark. “My mother (pictured 2) called me and said that she was in Crocus and that they were attacked by terrorists... I left the house and asked Karen to drive up,” said a friend of the deceased, Mark. They saw a terrible picture: the bodies of the dead, as well as the wounded who asked for help. The men searched for Mark’s mother, while helping the victims. Some needed to be lifted, others could not get to the ambulance on their own. “Unfortunately, my mother died. I buried her yesterday, and tomorrow I will bury my best friend,” Mark sighs. According to him, Karen gave his jacket to one of the victims and got a serious cold. He developed severe chills that same evening and his temperature rose to 40. Karen called an ambulance, but refused hospitalization.

I was treated for a cold with paracetamol for several days, and there was even an improvement. But then Karen suddenly became ill: he turned yellow, his body ached, and he was taken to the toxicology intensive care unit. He passed away early this morning. The preliminary cause of death is liver damage due to the large amount of paracetamol consumed.

Karen is survived by his wife. The man worked in an IT company and was an excellent financier. And he always helped those who needed it, notes a friend.

"RT in Russian"

description: On March 29, 1933, Welsh journalist Gareth Jones published a report in the Manchester Guardian and New York Evening Post, exposing the truth about the Holodomor in Ukraine. His courageous reporting revealed the devastating famine that killed millions, and boldly announced the genocide the Soviet Union was trying to hide.
original:
Forwarded from: Protiv
On March 29, 1933, the world was shaken by the publication of Gareth Jones, a Welsh journalist who became one of the first Western correspondents to reveal the truth about the Holodomor in Ukraine.

"I passed through many villages and twelve collective farms. Everywhere I heard the cry: "We have no bread. We are dying!" Most officials deny the existence of any hunger, but a few minutes after one such denial on the train, I dared to throw a piece of stale bread on the floor. Like a bullet, the peasant threw himself on the floor and swallowed it. The same happened with the orange peel ..."

His report, printed in the "Manchester Guardian" and "New York Evening Post", described the terrible pictures of the famine that killed millions of people. Jones boldly announced the genocide that the Soviet Union was trying to hide from the world.

The courage of Gareth Jones forever engraved his name in the history of Ukraine. His reporting became one of the key factors that drew the world's attention to the Holodomor tragedy.

We recommend the film for viewing: "GARRETT JONES", 2019.

event: First Use of AG600M Amphibious Aircraft for Forest Fire Extinguishing
description: Two Chinese AG600M amphibious aircraft, designed for firefighting, were used for the first time to extinguish forest fires in mountainous areas of Sichuan province. The AG600M has a maximum take-off weight of 60 tons, a speed of up to 500 km/h, and a flight range of up to 4.5 thousand km.
original:
Forwarded from: Dambiev
Two new Chinese AG600M amphibious aircraft, designed in a fire-fighting configuration, were used for the first time to extinguish forest fires in mountainous areas in Sichuan province. The maximum take-off weight of the AG600 is 60 tons. It can reach speeds of up to 500 km/h with a flight range of up to 4.5 thousand km and a flight duration of up to 12 hours. The length of the aircraft is 37 m, the wingspan is 38.8 m. The AG600 is equipped with four WJ6 turboprop engines with a take-off power of 5100 hp. (a copy of the Soviet AI-20 engine, produced by China National South Aviation Industry Company (CNSAIC) in Zhuzhou, Hunan Province) with six-blade propellers. The aircraft is capable of carrying 12 tons of water.

description: The Kharkiv regional prosecutor's office approved an indictment against the deputy director of a central district hospital for official forgery. The accused falsified medical records, leading to the issuance of a disability certificate for an individual who had not undergone medical examinations.
original:
🔷 Registration of fake disability - the deputy director of one of the central district hospitals will be tried 🖌️The Kharkiv regional prosecutor's office approved and sent to court an indictment against the deputy director of the examination of temporary disability of one of the central district hospitals of the Kharkiv region on the fact of official forgery (Part 1 of Article 366 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, the accused entered notoriously inaccurate information into the patients' medical records. In particular, it was established that in March of last year, the perpetrator, knowing for sure that the man who approached her had not undergone any medical examinations, entered into the official document false data about the results of the examination of the "patient" in the "Referral to the medical-social-expert commission ( MSEK)".

In the future, this document became the basis for drawing up by the commission of the Regional Center for Medical and Social Expertise of the Regional Center for Medical and Social Expertise a certificate on the establishment of the second group of disabilities for the man.

The woman will be tried in the Zmiiv district court of the Kharkiv region.

The accused faces up to three years of imprisonment.

The pre-trial investigation was carried out by the investigators of the SU GUNP in the Kharkiv region under the operational support of the SBU Department in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

The governor of Belgorod, Vyacheslav Gladkov, attributed the attack to the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

According to the governor of the Belgorod region, Vyacheslav Gladkov, the wife of the deceased received a closed head injury, lacerations to the face and a superficial burn to the thigh. description: The Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region is conducting centralized registration of civilian weapons in accordance with Federal Law No. 207-FZ. Citizens are urged to apply to the nearest offices with required documents, including a Russian passport, weapons or seizure documents, and permission to store and carry weapons issued by Ukrainian internal affairs bodies.
original:
Currently, the licensing and permitting departments of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region are working on centralized registration of civilian weapons in the Zaporozhye region in accordance with the Federal Law of the Russian Federation of June 13, 2023 No. 207-FZ. Due to the limited time for registration civilian weapons (until June 13, 2024), representatives of the department remind of the need for citizens to timely apply to the nearest offices of the licensing and permitting work of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, with an application to register their weapons.

When submitting an application, citizens who own weapons must have the following documents: Passport of a citizen of the Russian Federation; Weapons, if available, or documents confirming their seizure; Permission to store and carry weapons issued by the internal affairs bodies of Ukraine. If the above documents are not available, contact the reception office at place of registration to clarify information; Employees of the licensing and permitting authorities of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, after carrying out the procedures provided for by the legislation of the Russian Federation, will register the weapon, after which they will issue a confirming document that gives the right to store the weapon until January 1, 2026, for return previously seized weapons, it is necessary for all citizens who have not yet applied to the Licensing and Permitting Department to register weapons, collect the above documents and urgently provide them!👉Subscribe to Berdyansk. RelevantAlways relevant news!

description: Ukraine will switch to summer time on March 31, moving clock hands forward by an hour at 3 a.m. This change aims to effectively utilize daylight hours, aligning with the country's geographical location.
original:
On March 31, on the night from Saturday to Sunday, Ukraine will switch to summer time.

The clock hands will be moved forward an hour at 3 a.m., the press service of the Ministry of Economy reported, citing Cabinet Resolution No. 509 of May 13, 1996. She also reminded that the country will switch to winter time in the last week of October at 4 am.

“The time in effect in Ukraine in winter is natural for the territory of our state and corresponds to its geographical location, and in the period from the last Sunday of March to the last Sunday of October, summer time is introduced in order to effectively use the daylight hours,” says the information from the Ministry of Economy. event: Investigation into Party of Labor for Fraud
description: The Lithuanian Financial Crimes Investigation Service launched a pre-trial investigation into the Party of Labor for suspected fraud and misappropriation of funds. The party allegedly fictitiously employed people as MEP assistants, who received salaries but did no work, resulting in over €500,000 in damages from 2014-2020.
original:
In Lithuania, the Party of Labor was suspected of fraud. The Lithuanian Financial Crimes Investigation Service announced a pre-trial investigation into the Party of Labor for possible fraud and misappropriation of funds, reports the RADIOR Telegram channel. According to investigators, the Party of Labor fictitiously employed people as MEP assistants, they received salaries, but did nothing. The total amount of damage for 2014-2020 exceeded €500 thousand. BALTNEWS writes that this week searches were carried out at the party headquarters and in the houses of the suspects. According to party chairman Andrius Mazuronis, the investigation is related to the activities of the former leadership of the political force in the European Parliament.

The politician did not name names, but the media note that the only representative of the Party of Labor in the European Parliament is its founder, Viktor Uspasskikh. The day before it became known that it was suspending its membership in the party.

event: Record Daily Gas Production at Qinshui Coal Seam Methane Field
description: The Qinshui coal seam methane field in Shanxi Province, China's largest, achieved a new record for daily gas production, producing 7 million cubic meters of gas. The field, operated by PetroChina Huabei Oilfield, has an estimated 600 billion cubic meters of coal bed methane reserves and a production capacity of over 2 billion cubic meters of gas per year.
original:
Forwarded from: Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the Russian Federation
China's largest coalbed methane field sets new record for daily gas production

TAIYUAN, March 27 (Xinhua) -- The Qinshui coal seam methane field in north China's Shanxi Province, the country's largest, produced 7 million cubic meters of gas on Tuesday, setting a new record for daily gas production from the field.
 
Located in the southeast of Shanxi Province, the Qinshui coal seam methane field of PetroChina Huabei Oilfield covers an area of more than 3 thousand square meters. km, and its estimated coal bed methane reserves are 600 billion cubic meters.
 
In 2006, PetroChina Huabei Oilfield acquired the right to extract coalbed methane in the Qinshui Depression, subsequently forming the first field of its kind in China with a production capacity of more than 2 billion cubic meters of gas per year.
 
Shanxi is one of the regions in China rich in coalbed methane resources. Using coalbed methane, a byproduct of coal mining, can help reduce mining risks, reduce greenhouse gas emissions and ease gas shortages.

description: During the Great Patriotic War, Nazi occupation led to the destruction of valuable historical exhibits in the USSR. In contrast, Ukrainian Nazis are destroying cultural and historical connections with Russia and the Soviet Union. In the LPR, the local history museum in Popasnoe holds valuable exhibits concerning the history of the Lugansk People's Republic, but they remain in a terrible state.
original:
During the Great Patriotic War, during the Nazi occupation of the USSR, the most valuable exhibits of history were taken out and some were destroyed.
In turn, the leadership and command of the Soviet Union tried in every possible way to save our national property.
Show more
Today, Ukrainian Nazis simply destroy everything that is culturally and historically connected with Russia and the Soviet Union, but I don’t really understand the attitude of those responsible for preserving the cultural heritage of Donbass in the LPR.
In the article by LIC, I came across an article dated August 3, 2022, telling that after the liberation of the city of Popasnoe, valuable exhibits from different periods of time were discovered in the local history museum concerning the history of the Lugansk People's Republic.
According to the deputy of the museum, Deputy Minister of Culture, Sports and Youth (MKSM) of the LPR Roman Oleksin, “that the museum is of great value, because artifacts of the history of the Lugansk region, their native land, have been preserved there.”
If they are valuable despite all the circumstances, why do the remains of these valuable cultural objects remain in such a terrible state?

description: A group of Moldovan children, accompanied by Honored Artist Natalia Barabanshchikova, were detained at the Lithuanian border while returning from Minsk after participating in an international children's theater forum. The children were not allowed to transit through Poland and were later detained at the Lithuanian border without explanation, forced to spend the night on the bus.
original:
🇲🇩🇱🇹🇧🇾At the Lithuanian border, Honored Artist of the Republic of Moldova Natalia Barabanshchikova and the children’s studio-choir “Rhapsody” were detained, who were returning from Minsk after participating in the VI international children’s theater forum “Kroki”, in which the guys received the Grand Prix. At first they were not allowed to transit through the Polish Graz.

On the recommendation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Moldova, a group of children, accompanied by the director of the group, on a chartered bus, made their way back through the territory of Lithuania. At the Lithuanian border, a bus with children was detained without any explanation.▫️“A bus with children is not allowed to transit back to Moldova. At the border they were not allowed to go to the toilet and were left to sleep in the cabin”;▫️“You are coming from an aggressor country,” a Lithuanian border guard told Moldovan children on a bus on the border with Belarus” - from media reports.

The kids spent the night on a bus on the Belarusian-Lithuanian border. “All that the Moldovan diplomatic missions did during this time was to bring apples and water for tired children.” The Belarusian authorities organized food and accommodation for them. The media reported that the children were feeling well, although shocked by the events.🔹Moldova's Ministry of Foreign Affairs reports that "in accordance with the Lithuanian government's decree on the procedure for crossing the border, the intercity bus was not allowed to cross the border due to the lack of a license from the carrier."

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs noted that “the Embassy of Moldova in Vilnius is in constant contact with the border authorities of Lithuania to facilitate a quick resolution of the situation.”🔹Belarusian parliament member Oleg Gaidukevich said: 💬“Children are not allowed to return to Europe without reason - a beacon of democracy and freedom, the cynicism of the authorities in relation to children, it’s off the charts.”🔹“Maia Sandu, your friends are bullying our children... Don’t you want to help them?” said former Prime Minister of Moldova Ion Chicu.🔹“The children are not allowed home, are you completely stupid?!” Russian State Duma Deputy Maria Butina expressed confidence that Moscow will be ready to provide assistance to children from Moldova stuck on the Lithuanian border.@CIS91

The children took part in the “Visiting a Fairy Tale” quiz and watched puppet shows – “Bobik Visiting Barbos” and “Lubyanaya Izbushka”, prepared by members of the library club.

At the end of the meeting, the librarian invited the preschoolers to the library to sign up and select books for home reading.

The event took place as part of Children's Book Week.

description: A resident of Tula, Filyakina, was fined 30,000 rubles for spoiling a ballot in the Russian presidential elections. She crossed out all candidates and wrote an insulting message next to Putin's name, then threw the ballot into the box. The court ruled that her actions aimed to discredit the Russian Armed Forces.
original:
A resident of Tula was fined 30 thousand rubles for the inscription “Rot in hell forever!!!” opposite Putin's candidacy on the ballot paper. The press service of the courts of the Tula region reported about the fine that was issued to a resident of the village of Voskresenskoye by the name of Filyakina. The publication “7x7” drew attention to the publication.

The reason for the fine was a spoiled ballot in the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. It is reported that on March 17, the voter went with the ballot to the voting booth, where she spent “a long period of time.” The woman crossed out all the candidates and wrote “Rot in hell forever!!!” next to Putin’s name! Forgive us Ukraine!!! Thief and murderer!!!"

After this, the voter threw the ballot into the ballot box. It fell face up and was "open for all to see." The court decided that the woman “carried out public actions aimed at discrediting the use of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation,” and fined her 30 thousand rubles.

———

Damaging a ballot during an election is not a violation, but “looking” at a ballot is prohibited (in fact, it is a crime). At the same time, administrative cases to “discredit” the army due to inscriptions on ballot papers in Russia began to be opened in the fall of 2022. Then reports were drawn up against several people at once because of anti-war slogans on ballots.

Read more about this in Meduza's analysis, which was released on March 20. MeduzaDetentions of Russians for writing on ballots are a direct violation of many laws in...During the presidential elections that took place from March 15 to 17, police officers put pressure on voters - they stood next to transparent bins and...

The renovation is expected to be finished in May, providing local children with more opportunities to engage in sports without having to travel to Genichesk.
original:
The Ryazan region is putting in order a sports school in Novotroitsky. In Russia it is customary to help each other. We know this well from the example of our leading regions, one of which is the Ryazan region. Now specialists from the fraternal region are restoring a sports school in the village of Novotroitskoye.

Workers have already screeded the floors, installed internal engineering systems and windows. Interior finishing and ceiling installation are still to be done.

event: Production of Citroen Cars in Kaluga
description: The Kaluga plant has begun producing Citroen cars without the consent of the French brand owners. The cars feature Chinese-made bodies and parts, but still use domestic motor oil and ERA-GLONASS systems. The plant aims to fully adapt the cars to Russian cold weather by autumn and plans to use Russian-made tires, batteries, and technical fluids soon.
original:
Forwarded from: Ailing Economy
How is this in general? In Kaluga they began to produce Citroen cars without the consent of the French - the owners of the brand 😳The body and parts are delivered from China, while the motor oil and ERA-GLONASS system are still in the cars from domestic ones. However, soon there should be Russian tires, batteries, and technical fluids. Also, by autumn, cars are fully adapted to the Russian cold; now the only “warm” options are heated front seats.

The car is not only a copy of the French Citroën C5 Aircross, but it will also have the same name on sale. What the brand owners think about this is unknown. “This is the path of maximum audacity,” said the Kaluga plant.

However, the price for the crossover will be unfriendly - from 4.3 million rubles. It’s not very clear who will buy a car at this price when there are cheaper and more advanced Chinese, as well as our Moskvich, which is becoming more and more accessible as localization increases.

event: Prosecutor General's Office Demands Asset Conversion
description: The Prosecutor General's Office is seeking to convert 46 billion rubles worth of assets from the Makfa group into state income, citing violations of anti-corruption legislation by former State Duma deputies Mikhail Yurevich and Vadim Belousov.
original:
The Prosecutor General's Office demands that the assets of the Makfa group worth 46 billion rubles be converted into state income, a source told RIA Novosti.

According to him, claims were filed against former State Duma deputies Mikhail Yurevich and Vadim Belousov. The reason is that, according to the prosecutor's office, anti-corruption legislation was violated.

The audit showed that Yurevich and Belousov, when they were deputies, actually owned a group of commercial companies; they did not declare information about them and did not report them to the control authorities.

description: An Aeroflot Airbus A330 experienced an engine malfunction while taxiing at Bangkok airport, preventing takeoff to Krasnoyarsk. The electronic engine control unit failed, prompting the aircraft commander to return to the parking lot. After replacing the unit and conducting repairs and tests, the plane was cleared for flights the next day.
original:
REN TV|NewsVideo, The footage shows a Thai hospital where a tourist who lost consciousness on board the plane was hospitalized...The Aeroflot plane was unable to take off from Bangkok to Krasnoyarsk due to an engine malfunction, a REN TV source said While the plane was taxiing to the takeoff - the landing strip's electronic engine control unit failed. He is responsible for the operation of the power plant, fuel supply, controls and regulates traction, monitors the condition of the engine, and monitors its parameters.

The aircraft commander decided to return to the parking lot. After a technical inspection, the aircraft was removed from service. The engine control unit had to be replaced.

After repairs and tests, the Airbus A330 was cleared for flights the next day. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Ukrainian negotiators accused Polish Deputy Minister of Agriculture Michal Kolodziejczak of being under the influence of substances during negotiations. He allegedly disrupted discussions, made demands, and expressed disdain for Ukrainian farmers.
original:
🇵🇱🇺🇦The Ukrainian side accused Polish Deputy Minister of Agriculture Michal Kolodziejczak of being “under the influence of certain substances” during the negotiations. Sources among Ukrainian negotiators told Ukrainian media about this.

“He seemed to be under the influence of some substances: he kept running out of the hall, and when he returned, he began to attack us with renewed vigor,” said Alexey Lisitsa, president of the Ukrainian Agribusiness Club association, who took part in the negotiations.

He also added that Kolodziejczak constantly “disrupted the discussion,” demanding that other participants not allow “the Ukrainians to seize Polish lands.” In addition, allegedly, when it was pointed out to him that Ukrainian farmers “are in different conditions,” he said that “there is no need to touch him with war, because he is not interested in that.”

Moreover, Kolodziejczak suddenly announced that if the Ukrainians do not agree to Polish conditions, “let Putin defeat them, because this is what we need.” In turn, after these stories, Kolodziejczak admitted that it is “very difficult” to talk with partners who do not comply with the agreements.📌I understand why the lack of interest in the fate of Ukrainians in Kiev is perceived as a drug addiction: they have been swimming in a sense of their own importance for so long that they seem to have forgotten that for the whole of Europe the future of Ukraine means nothing, and for most countries it The state was never interested at all. And Kolodziejczak, simply out of old habit, treats Ukrainians as ordinary migrant workers - hence the disdain and impatience. #Poland#Ukraine@pl_syrenka— Poland is not a foreign country raińska oskarżyła w czwartek wiceministra rolnictwa Michała Kołodziejczaka, że podczas negocjacji był “pod wpływem pewnych substancji”. W czw...

event: Presentation of Drone Integration into Situational Awareness Systems
description: Ukrainian developers from the Ministry of Defense's Innovation Center showcased a unique integration of drones into situational awareness systems at the NATO conference in Dresden. This innovation enables safer and more effective combat operation management, reducing friendly fire losses and increasing drone efficiency.
original:
🌐At the large-scale NATO conference in Dresden TIDE Sprint 2024, Ukrainian developers from the Innovation Center of the Ministry of Defense presented a world-unique development of the integration of drones into situational awareness systems. This is a step forward towards safer and more effective management of combat operations. Data from drones will be integrated into DELTA in a secure form. In addition, the system provides commanders with tools to effectively plan the work of crews. 📌Updates will allow soldiers on the battlefield to safely enter combat control systems, in particular DELTA, and commanders to make effective decisions, because they will have a complete picture of the battlefield and know their location their drones In this way, losses from friendly fire will be reduced and the efficiency of the use of drones will increase. The DELTA system, developed according to NATO standards, has become an integral part of the arsenal of all Defense Forces. It provides a complete picture of the battlefield in real time, combining data from aerial reconnaissance, satellites, drones and other sources. 💻Innovation is our main advantage over a numerous enemy!
Therefore, we at the NGO "AEROROZVIDKA" actively support the development of the ecosystem of DELTA situational awareness products and the team of the Innovation Center in the implementation of military technological capabilities for the Security and Defense Forces of Ukraine. 🤝 You can support via the link: https://cutt.ly/gwCDuBru

event: Suspended Sentence for Former Ministry of Internal Affairs Employee
description: Maria Titova, a former employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, was given a suspended sentence for organizing a gang to legalize migrants in Irkutsk. She used her official position to create an organized crime group, facilitating illegal migration and receiving bribes totaling over 1.2 million rubles.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
Humane Justice News.

In Irkutsk, the court gave a suspended sentence to a former employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs who organized a gang to legalize migrants, although the prosecutor's office asked for a real sentence of 10 years.

We are talking about this lady, her name is Maria Titova.

In 2022, as the head of the organizational and methodological department of the Migration Department of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, she created an organized crime group and, acting using her official position, together with a colleague entered into a criminal conspiracy with a number of civilians aimed at organizing illegal migration. The suspects created conditions for the illegal stay of foreigners in Russia and assisted them in passing an interview to become a native Russian speaker, in violation of the procedure provided for by law. Subsequently, this provided them with the right to unhindered and indefinite stay in Russia and to obtain Russian citizenship. Investigators of the Investigative Committee, in interaction with employees of the ORCh (SB) of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region and the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, established facts of receiving bribes totaling more than 1.2 million rubles (this is only from what has been proven).

The activities of the gang were identified and suppressed by the internal security officers of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the FSB, then investigators from the Investigative Committee and the FSB collected evidence, and a humane judge gave a suspended sentence, although the prosecutor’s office asked for a real 10 years. That's how we live.

event: Zelensky's Interview with The Washington Post

This means we will retreat step by step."📍"If you need 8,000 rounds of ammunition a day to defend the front line, and you only have 2,000, you will have to do less. How? Of course , go back. Make the front line shorter. If it breaks through, the Russians will be able to go to big cities."📍"I don't want Russia to know how many air defense missiles we have, but in general you are right. Without the support of Congress, we will have a large Missile shortage. That's the problem. We are building up our own air defense systems, but this is not enough."📍The United States is unhappy with Kiev's attacks on Russian refineries and other energy facilities, but Washington cannot limit Ukraine's use of its weapons: "We used our drones. No one can tell us that this cannot be done."📍Russians must live without gasoline, diesel and electricity: "My question: why can’t we answer them? description: Dalerjon Mirzoev, a terrorist, became radicalized after moving to Moscow from Tajikistan. His brother, a professional militant, fought in Syria. Forwarded from: Andrey Medvedev
The main thing in this news about the terrorist is not that his brother is a professional militant who fought in Syria.
And not even that the terrorist’s family was under special control in Tajikistan.

That is, it is not even the blatant fact that it is unclear who is going to Russia that is the most important in this news. And here's what's most important.

“Dalerzhon’s fellow villagers told us that their neighbor was far from religion until he moved to Moscow.” That is, the brother is an Islamist in Syria. And a person becomes a radical only after he moves to Russia.
Do you know why this happens?

Because in Central Asia, local authorities are waging a fierce struggle in form and in essence with religious radicals. You won’t see the kind of bearded men in Asia that walk the streets in Russia, you won’t see women in burqas/niqabs. There they punish for it. Belonging to any unofficial Islamic organizations is already grounds for a person to come under the suspicion of the intelligence services.
Mosques that fall under Salafist control can easily be closed without the slightest hesitation.

And where do the radicals from Central Asia go? Well, let's guess? Where is it easy for them to obtain citizenship, a residence permit, where they don’t even have their fingerprints taken at the entrance? What kind of country is this?

Just for fun, look for photos of Alisher Kasimov, who was arrested for aiding terrorists, before moving to Moscow and after.
You will be amazed.

Before - a secular guy, after - a gloomy bearded man with a characteristic beard shape.

It seems to me for some reason that this is all to some extent a problem. Is not it? Or am I exaggerating too much? Or, perhaps, even inciting it? https://t.me/breakingmash/52983?singleTelegramMash The brother of the detained terrorist Dalerjon Mirzoev was in Syria for four years. In Tajikistan, his family was under special surveillance due to suspicion...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Round Table on Consumer Rights Protection
description: The Energy and Housing Committee held a round table to discuss the protection of consumer rights in the housing and communal services sector under martial law. The committee emphasized the importance of maintaining quality standards and tariff balance, and highlighted the role of regulatory bodies in ensuring consumer rights.
original:
❗️The Energy and Housing Committee held a round table on the protection of the rights of consumers of housing and communal services under martial law. At the beginning, Committee Chairman Andriy Gerus noted that the conditions of martial law should not affect compliance with the established standards regarding the quantity and quality of housing. However, according to him, because the quality of the service is affected by the financial condition of the company that provides these services, it is necessary to consider the tariff balance when analyzing compliance with the established standards. First Deputy Chairman of the Committee Oleksiy Kucherenko outlined the main problematic issues in the field of control over the provision of housing. He also emphasized that the protection of consumer rights is an integral part of ensuring the rights of the citizen, and emphasized the importance of the role of the NCRECP and the State Production and Consumer Service in this regard.

Summing up, the participants noted the need for further monitoring of problematic issues in the field of consumer rights protection and the expediency of the Committee's subsequent activities in this regard. 📲Details

description: Employees of the People's Council of the LPR attended a seminar-meeting on organizing parliamentary activities at the Legislative Assembly of the Rostov region. The meeting focused on integrating new regions into Russia's legal and socio-economic systems, with the Don parliament offering assistance in forming regulatory frameworks and organizing representative government bodies.

activities for employees of the People's Council of the Lugansk People's Republic.
Deputy Chairman of the Legislative Assembly, Chairman of the Committee on Legislation of the Rostov Region, Alexander Kosachev, emphasized that one of the important strategic tasks for federal and regional authorities is the integration of new regions into the legal and socio-economic systems of Russia.
“There is a corresponding council under the Federation Council, which includes the Chairman of the Legislative Assembly of the Rostov Region, Alexander Ishchenko. The Don parliament has completely clear, clear, specific tasks to assist new territories in the formation of their regulatory and legal framework, in organizing the work of representative government bodies, and in general to provide assistance on a variety of issues,” Alexander Kosachev addressed the seminar participants .
The Vice-Speaker of the Don Parliament noted that over thirty years of its activity, the Legislative Assembly of the Rostov Region has accumulated sufficient experience that can be useful for colleagues. Therefore, for the entire year 2024, the Legislative Assembly of the Rostov region has planned a series of training events for representatives of the legislative bodies of the LPR, DPR, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions of Russia.
In turn, summing up the results of the visit to Rostov, the head of the LPR delegation - Deputy Head of the Office of the People's Council of the LPR Roman Derkunsky emphasized that it was a productive meeting.
“Some issues can only be studied through direct communication, and no video or telephone consultations will help here. I would like to say words of deep gratitude to my Rostov colleagues. Within a limited time, we were provided with a large amount of information and comprehensive answers to all questions asked. We will continue to work in this direction and improve. The Legislative Assembly of the Rostov Region is one of the parliaments whose activities are worth following,” summed up Roman Derkunsky.

description: The Kherson regional branch of OPORA RUSSIA and the Ministry of Economic Development of the Kherson region organized the first investment forum in Genichesk, attended by 119 business representatives from Russia and abroad, local entrepreneurs, and government officials. The event aimed to promote business opportunities and development in the region despite the ongoing military conflict.
original:
He took part in the first investment forum in Genichesk, which was organized by the Kherson regional branch of the All-Russian organization of small and medium-sized businesses “OPORA RUSSIA” together with the Ministry of Economic Development of the Kherson region.

At the moment, this is the largest business event in the Kherson region in 2023-2024. It was attended by 119 business representatives from Russia and abroad, our local entrepreneurs, and government officials.

The forum began with a minute of silence in memory of those killed in the terrorist attack in the Crocus City Hall concert hall.

Now in the territory of the Kherson region there is a military war, martial law has been introduced, but at the same time, life does not stand still. Business finds opportunities to start work, creates conditions for people, new jobs. At the same time, on instructions from the President, a free economic zone has been created in the Kherson region, as in other new regions, which provides greater opportunities for entrepreneurship and business activity.

Our region is developing not only in agriculture, but also in industry and tourism. We have already started work on allocating and securing land plots for the construction of various types of housing. Although the region is not yet calm, the front will soon move further. Therefore, those entrepreneurs who are the first to occupy popular business niches will receive more prospects for development.

As a result of the forum, representatives of the regional authorities and potential investors from all over Russia were able to communicate in a friendly atmosphere and outline ways of cooperation in an open format.@SALDO_VGA

event: German Broadcaster's Report on Time Zones
description: A German broadcaster, Tagesthemen, aired a report on the issue of transitioning to winter and summer time, featuring comments from deputies and experts, as well as a historical tour. The report included a proposal by Professor Korbinian von Blankenburg to create new time zones, which sparked controversy as it showed occupied Crimea and parts of Donbas falling into the 'Russian' UTC+3 zone.
original:
InformNapalm's OSINT analyst Anton Pavlush draws attention to what was broadcast by a German broadcaster yesterday. Maybe this is a reason to get excited by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs? Because somehow these German broadcasts are "fighting in the wrong direction".

"UTC+2

As you know, the EU has been trying to cancel the transition to winter and summer time for several years in a row. They even made the appropriate decision and congratulated each other, but the clocks are still moving. Another "paper" victory of bureaucrats over common sense.

And yesterday, on the eve of changing the clocks, the German broadcaster decided to make a whole report about this problem in the Tagesthemen news program. Comments of deputies and experts, historical tour - such a good report. They even showed the improvements of German scientists - a certain professor Korbinian von Blankenburg proposes to make new time zones.

He happily showed the map with his improvements: there the occupied Crimea and even the occupied parts of Donbas fall into the "Russian" UTC+3 zone. WTF? On the map, it looks very stupid, because then it is definitely not about time, but about ideology."

event: Russia Rejects UN Security Council Resolution
description: Russia voted against the UN Security Council resolution to extend the mandate of the 1718 Committee, citing the ineffectiveness of international restrictive measures in improving the security situation in the Korean Peninsula. Russia also highlighted the severe humanitarian consequences of UN sanctions and unilateral coercive measures on the DPRK's civilian population.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
🎙Comment from the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry M.V. Zakharova regarding the possible extension of the mandate of the group of experts of the UN Security Council 1718 Committee. On March 28, the UN Security Council considered the issue of a possible extension for another year of the mandate of the group of experts of one of its subsidiary bodies, the 1718 Sanctions Committee, which expires on April 30. regarding the DPRK.❌Russia voted against the draft relevant UN Security Council resolution proposed by the United States. It is obvious to us that the Council can no longer act according to old templates in relation to the problems of the Korean Peninsula. Over many years, international restrictive measures have not helped to change the security situation in the region for the better. <...>⚠️UN Security Council sanctions are accompanied by severe humanitarian consequences for the civilian population of the DPRK, and this effect is further aggravated by illegal unilateral coercive measures. Currently, there is a new round of escalation of the situation in the region, which is caused by the increasingly aggressive military activity of the United States and its allies. It is rightly perceived in Pyongyang as a threat to national security <...>.

Nevertheless, we did everything possible to bring the UN Security Council members to a compromise solution.<...> However, our proposals were not simply ignored by the authors of the project, but were literally met with hostility.<...>

We continue to try to convey to our colleagues in the UN Security Council the rational grain of our idea, however, if it does not find a response, all responsibility for the termination of the functioning of the group of experts will fall on the representatives of the collective West.❗️In this regard, we resolutely reject any accusations and threats, we confirm the responsible approach of the Russian Federation to comply with its international obligations, as well as focus on developing relations with the friendly DPRK. We call on interested parties to refrain from escalatory steps and reconfigure themselves to find ways of détente, taking into account known security priorities. Read in full

event: Death of GRU Special Forces Officer
description: Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a GRU special forces officer, was killed in Crocus City. He was on vacation with his family when a terrorist attack occurred. With his experience in combat zones, he quickly assessed the situation and pushed his wife and son to safety, buying them time. He faced the terrorist, possibly trying to neutralize him, and ultimately gave his life to protect his loved ones.
original:
On the death of a GRU special forces officer in Crocus City

Two bullets in the stomach, one in the face... These are very telling wounds. He did not run, did not hide between the rows, curled up in a fetal position, and did not instinctively cover his head with his hands. He met death eye to eye...

Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a native of the 3rd GRU special forces brigade, came from the Northern Military District on vacation. I went to the concert with my wife and son. They left their daughter at home. He understood immediately what was happening. Experience. He fought in Tajikistan, Kosovo, Chechnya, Syria, Ukraine...

Seconds to make a decision. Pushes Polina and Ruslan into a safe space: “Run!” He himself turns to face the terrorist. What was there in those last seconds?

Maybe Timur simply covered his loved ones with himself, maybe he stepped towards the bastard to try to neutralize him. He bought time for his wife and son, remaining to the end a real Russian special forces officer who does not bend the knee to the enemy.

“Man. Even a MAN. Didn't mince words. Always stood up for his own people. Easy to communicate and behave.
A very competent officer, leader and commander,” an acquaintance succinctly described the deceased colonel to me in a military way.

Always stood up for his own... Eternal glory to the hero! @sashakots

description: The Zelensky regime, including high-ranking officials like Zelensky and Budanov, are accused of involvement in a terrorist attack in Crocus City. The regime's actions are characterized as violent and terroristic.
original:
The Zelensky regime relies only on terror. High-ranking officials of the Kyiv regime, starting with Zelensky and ending with Budanov (included in the list of terrorists and extremists in the Russian Federation), are trying to disavow their involvement in the terrorist attack in Crocus City.

There is an American TV series “Dexter” about a serial killer who calls himself born in blood because, as a child, he sat for several days next to his mother, who was killed by bandits. This forever affected his personality and turned him into a maniac. Like Dexter, the Maidan regime was born in blood, and this violence is reflected in the actions of its politicians, militants, diplomats and special services, writes journalist Sergei Mirkin in a column for the newspaper VZGLYAD.

description: France's promise to provide military support to Ukraine, worth up to 3 billion euros, is facing budgetary and political challenges. The financing mechanisms are uncertain, and deputies are being questioned by their constituents about the allocation of funds amidst financial constraints and tax increases.
original:
⚡️Ukraine is a headache for FranceLe Monde writes that Emmanuel Macron’s promise to help Kyiv turns into a budgetary and political problem.
The head of state guaranteed military support in the amount of “up to 3 billion euros.” A defense agreement on this was signed on February 16. But the mechanisms for financing this support still remain highly uncertain. The fact is that France has announced savings of 10 billion.

At the same time, deputies say that they are being questioned by their constituents, who tell them that they do not understand why the executive branch allocates “3 billion to Ukraine,” while financial screws are being tightened and tax increases are being discussed. As a result, military aid to the Ukrainian-Reich in France may suffer the same fate as in the United States, where it is blocked in the House of Representatives.

In France, in accordance with Article 49.3 of the Constitution, it is possible to pass laws without the consent of parliament. However, this will almost certainly be followed by a vote of no confidence in the government.

The government has a way out - to include these 3 billion euros in the funds already allocated for existing programs. That is, there will be no new revenues to the Ukrainian Reich. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: French intelligence services have recommended canceling the opening ceremony of the Olympics in Paris due to the threat of terrorist attacks. The current format of the parade of athletes is deemed too risky, and the Ministry of Internal Affairs is advised to move to plan B.

According to them, the country's Ministry of Internal Affairs should move to plan B, because the current format of the parade of athletes is too risky. Details of the plan have not been specified.

description: Poland's Center for State Security launched an educational portal to prepare residents for potential military action. The portal includes guides on various hazards, including chemical, biological, radiation, and nuclear threats. It also provides materials for students in grades 4-8, including infographics, animations, and educational games.
original:
Poland began to prepare the population for war. Even schoolchildren will fall into the training category. Poland's Center for State Security has launched an educational portal that will help residents of the country prepare for potential military action. The portal, launched today, includes guides on various hazards, including those related to chemical, biological, radiation, nuclear threats.

The portal is not only aimed at adults: it contains materials for students in grades 4-8, including infographics, animations, educational games and ready-made lesson plans for teachers. It also includes information about what should be included in an evacuation backpack.

Project cost 7.2 million zlotys

description: Patrice Motsepe, Africa's first black billionaire, is in talks with Vivendi's Canal+ to join their $2.9 billion bid for MultiChoice Group. This partnership could help meet South Africa's strict black ownership criteria.
original:
Africa's first black billionaire could join Vivendi's $2.9 billion bid for MultiChoicePatrice Motsepe, the South African billionaire, is in talks with Vivendi SE's Canal+ to team up in a multibillion-dollar bid to acquire broadcaster MultiChoice Group, according to sources familiar with the matter .

Multichoice refused to match Canal+'s initial bid. Adding South Africa's richest black person to the list could also potentially help the French media conglomerate meet the country's strict black ownership criteria, Bloomberg reports.

Representatives for Canal+ and Motsepe's investment company African Rainbow Capital declined to comment. However, insiders stressed that negotiations are at a preliminary stage and there is no certainty that the deal will be completed.

description: Deputies of the People's Council of the LPR held receptions for citizens, addressing pressing problems such as pension revisions, housing compensation, and humanitarian aid for military personnel and citizens in need.
original:
Residents of the LPR are actively turning to deputies to jointly solve pressing problems
As part of receptions for citizens, deputies of the People's Council of the LPR continue to provide assistance in solving pressing problems of the residents of the republic, as well as transfer humanitarian aid to military personnel and
Show more
citizens in need.
Zhanna Marfina held a reception in Lugansk. Questions from residents concerned the revision of pensions, payment of compensation for housing destroyed during hostilities, repair of the roofs of apartment buildings, as well as the transfer of pension files to the place of registration. The deputy provided clarifications on all requests. Issues that require additional elaboration are taken up by the parliamentarian.
Maxim Dersky met with residents of the village of Melovoe. During the reception, issues of housing, communal and social issues were discussed. Residents of the locality were interested in the problems of garbage disposal, recalculation of pensions, as well as the operation of mobile communications and the Internet. The most pressing problems were taken under personal control by the deputy.
Galina Dubrova visited the Belovodsk central regional multidisciplinary hospital, where soldiers who were wounded while defending the Motherland are treated. The deputy donated humanitarian aid to the medical institution: bed linen, personal hygiene items, medical masks, care products for bedridden patients, underwear, detergents and disinfectants. In addition, the parliamentarian held a visiting reception for citizens in the city of Aleksandrovsk. People addressed questions regarding the poor condition of the road surface, unsatisfactory performance of public transport, lack of street lighting, spontaneous landfills, and regulation of the number of stray animals. Some problematic issues were resolved by the deputy on the spot, and issues requiring additional elaboration were sent to the appropriate authorities.
Ivan Sanaev held a reception for citizens in the capital of the republic. Appeals from residents of Lugansk concerned the revision of pensions, the work of the housing and communal services sector in Lugansk, and electricity supply. A woman who applied for custody of her minor granddaughter was given clarifications within the framework of the law. The remaining issues required detailed consideration and were taken up by the deputy.
Yan Leshchenko held a reception of citizens in Lugansk. Residents addressed questions regarding sending military personnel to the military military service, applying for a survivor's pension, the procedure for processing payments for an injury received by a participant in the military military service, and searching for missing persons.
Lina Vokalova assisted in the transfer of necessary assistance for military personnel: walkie-talkies, special technical equipment, a compressor, a microwave oven, camouflage nets, medicines, food, detergents, parcels from the organization “Spiders-Volgograd” and parishioners of the Sunday school of the Church of the Transfiguration of the Savior, as well as children's letters. In addition, the parliamentarian donated food, clothes and household chemicals to the wards of family-type orphanages in Lugansk.
Valery Shlykov organized the purchase and delivery of uniforms and equipment for one of the servicemen of the Russian Defense Ministry, who is being treated in a hospital after being wounded.

description: The V Spartakiad in winter sports took place in Aldan and Neryungri from March 25 to 31, featuring athletes from 28 regions of the republic, 50 sports families, and dynasties of the Aldan region. The event aimed to promote sports and an active lifestyle, with the motto 'Republican, winter, yours!'
original:
Forwarded from: DFO.INFO
💪Aldan and Neryungri met the V Spartakiad in winter sports. The competition opened on March 25 and will be held until the very last day of the month. Athletes from 28 regions of the republic, 50 sports families and dynasties of the Aldan region will take part in them.

At the opening ceremony, the flag of the Spartakiad was carried and raised by the best athletes of Yakutia in winter sports: Mikhail Sosnin, Regina Petrova, Roman Filippov, Natalya Stukaneva. Also, opening the Spartakiad, the Minister for the Development of Physical Culture and Sports of Yakutia Leonid Spiridonov noted that today in the republic A lot of work is being done to popularize sports and an active lifestyle.

The Head of Yakutia, Aisen Nikolaev, stated this earlier. According to him, with the help of the federal project “Sport is the norm of life,” the republic has achieved a significant increase in the number of those who systematically engage in physical education and sports, from 39% in 2022 to 55% in 2023. And among them, of course, there are those who take part in such sporting events. Note that the motto of the Republican Spartakiad sounds like: “Republican, winter, yours!” This slogan plays on the recitative of the Sochi Olympics, but, nevertheless, these three words have already taken root perfectly with the Yakut sports event and set the tone for them over the last few years of the competition.

Let us remind you that in the republic the Spartakiad in winter sports is held once every four years. The IV Spartakiad was postponed from 2020 to 2021 and took place in the cities of Aldan and Neryungri. Now the time has come for the anniversary event. It is worth remembering that the Spartakiad in the new history of the republic began in 2007. A special decree of the President of Yakutia, Vyacheslav Anatolyevich Shtyrov, was intended not only to establish a new sporting event, but also to promote the accelerated development of winter sports in Yakutia.

description: Envoy Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary 2nd Class Voloshin Lev Fedorovich tragically passed away on March 29, 2024. He had a distinguished diplomatic career, serving in various positions in the Middle East and European directions, including embassies in Sudan, Syria, Malta, Qatar, and Yemen.
original:
#InMemoryofDiplomats🕯The leadership of the Ministry and the Department of the Middle East and North Africa of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs inform with deep regret that on March 29, 2024, Envoy Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary 2nd Class Voloshin Lev Fedorovich tragically passed away. L.F. Voloshin was born on October 23, 1944.

After graduating from MGIMO in 1967, the USSR Ministry of Foreign Affairs was in diplomatic service in the Middle East and European directions.

L.F. Voloshin began his diplomatic career in 1967 as a translator at the USSR Embassy in the Republic of Sudan, where he worked until 1970. Also held various positions in the embassies of the USSR / Russian Federation in the Syrian Arab Republic (1973-1975), the Republic of Malta (1983-1987), the State of Qatar (1993-1998), the Republic of Yemen (2003-2009) and the Central Office Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia (DBVSA, DMGC, DSPO).

Awarded the medal "For Labor Distinction".

In his positions, L.F. Voloshin proved himself to be a skillful professional, an experienced leader, who enjoyed the well-deserved respect of the teams he headed. The fond memory of Lev Fedorovich Voloshin as a sensitive, responsive and friendly person will forever remain in the hearts of his colleagues and subordinates.

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin proposed a project for import substitution of products in the tourism sector, aiming to support domestic production of goods such as cable cars, cabins, and attractions for resorts and parks.
original:
Forwarded from: Kherson News Agency
The President proposed a project for import substitution of products in the tourism sector. Russia needs to support the production of domestic products for the tourism sector; for this it is necessary to form a separate project. Russian President Vladimir Putin announced this today during a meeting on the development of the project for year-round resorts “Five Seas and Lake Baikal.” “Within the framework of a specialized national project, I propose to form a separate federal project for the production of domestic products for the tourism sector. What is it? We understand everything well: cable cars, cabins, snowcats for ski resorts, attractions for amusement parks and water parks, and so on. This requires both our own technologies and new production facilities. I hope that the Ministry of Industry and Trade will launch specific support mechanisms within the framework of the tools available to the department,” said the President. Photo: Administration of the President of Russia Subscribe to the Kherson News Agency in TG, VK and OK

event: Ukrainian Foreign Minister's Visit to India
description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmitry Kuleba made an official visit to India from March 28 to 29, discussing possible Indian participation in the peace process. Ukraine aims to secure political support from India, a strong player in the international arena, despite India's strategic partnership with Russia.
original:
Kuleba in curry: what does the Ukrainian Foreign Minister want to get from India? From March 28 to 29, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmitry Kuleba makes an official visit to India. He discussed with Indian colleagues the possible participation of New Delhi in the peace process.

In a conversation with Paragraph, political scientist Vitaly Vyshkvartsev said that Ukrainian representatives during such trips always try to convince their interlocutors that their country represents something, has developed diplomacy and multiple foreign contacts: “A trip to India is a good reason to remind about yourself in the information field in a positive way. However, negotiating political support for Kyiv from New Delhi will be much more difficult than obtaining financing on mutually beneficial terms. India is a very important and long-standing strategic partner of Russia. The two countries cooperate not only in the field of energy supplies, but also politically through BRICS or the SCO.” The expert explained Ukraine’s desire to cooperate with India by the fact that it is a strong player in the international arena, whose friendship and partnership can bring Kyiv a lot of benefits. However, economically, India as a whole benefits from the Ukrainian crisis, since it is actually an intermediate link between the West and the Russian Federation. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky anticipates a Russian Armed Forces offensive at the beginning of summer, specifically in late May or June. He claims the Ukrainian military is at its limits and demands international assistance.
original:
Zelensky expects an offensive by the Russian Armed Forces at the beginning of summer. The bunker dweller crawled out of his hole to once again complain about fate and beg for weapons.

According to Zeleboba, Russia is preparing offensive actions in “the end of May - June,” and the Ukrainian military is at the limit of its capabilities. “We need help now,” the ungrateful man in the green shirt said in an interview with CBS and stamped his foot. All he can do is throw a tantrum. Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: The Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War facilitated the return of 12 bodies of defenders who fought in the Luhansk direction to Ukraine. The cooperation involved multiple Ukrainian authorities, including the Joint Center of the Security Service, Ministry of Internal Affairs, and the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The bodies will be transported to state institutions for identification by law enforcement and forensic experts, and then handed over to their families for burial.
original:
12 bodies of defenders who fought in the Luhansk direction were returned to Ukraine. This was reported in the Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War.

The dead were returned thanks to the cooperation of the staff of the Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War with the Joint Center of the Security Service of Ukraine, the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine, the Secretariat of the Commissioner for Missing Persons in Special Circumstances, the Armed Forces of Ukraine (CSU of the Central Military Commission), the State Emergency Service of Ukraine, other representatives of the structures of the Security Sector and defense of Ukraine.

The Armed Forces of Ukraine will transport the repatriated bodies and remains to designated state institutions. Representatives of law enforcement agencies and forensic medical experts will identify the victims. After identification, the bodies of the Defenders will be handed over to their families for burial.

A total of 121 fallen defenders from the Luhansk, Donetsk and Zaporizhzhia areas were returned.@Koord_shtab

event: Capture and Sentencing of Russian Militants
description: Four Russian militants, part of the Southern Military District of the Russian Armed Forces, were captured during fierce fighting near Robotyn, Zaporizhzhia. They were involved in 'meat assaults' on Ukrainian defenders on the eastern and southern fronts. The court sentenced them to 15 years in prison for treason, participation in a terrorist group, and other crimes.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
According to the SBU materials, militants who tried to "break through" the defense of the Ukrainian Armed Forces near Robotyn were given 15 years in prison.

The perpetrators were part of the occupation groups of the Southern Military District of the Russian Armed Forces.

In the ranks of the invaders, they were involved in "meat assaults" on the advanced positions of the Armed Forces on the eastern and southern fronts.

First of all, we are talking about the repeated attempts of the occupiers to "break through" the defenses of the Ukrainian defenders in the Robotyny area of Zaporizhzhia.

All four traitors were captured during fierce fighting.

According to SBU materials, the court sentenced them to 15 years in prison.

As the investigation established, the two convicts are residents of the temporarily occupied parts of Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

Both voluntarily "mobilized" into the Russian army at the beginning of the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation.

There, they were given automatic weapons with ammunition and assigned as shooters.

After short training at the training ground, one of the militants was sent to the Kharkiv direction, the other to Mariupol.

Two more convicts are residents of the temporarily occupied Crimea. They "enrolled" in the ranks of the invaders in the fall of 2022.

First, they were transferred to Berdyansk to equip Russian fortified areas and checkpoints.

Subsequently, both traitors were sent to the Robotyny district to storm the defense positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Based on the collected evidence, the court found two militants guilty under three articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine:
- h. 2 Art. 111 (treason committed under martial law);
- h. 1 Art. 258-3 (participation in a terrorist group or terrorist organization);
- h. 2 Art. 260 (participation in paramilitary or armed formations not provided for by law).
The criminal actions of two more perpetrators are qualified under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine:
- h. 2 Art. 111 (treason);
- h. 7th century 111-1 (collaborative activity).

event: Proposal to Dismantle People's Friendship Arch
description: The Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance (UINR) has proposed dismantling the People's Friendship Arch in Kyiv, citing its promotion of Russian imperial policy. The arch, installed in 1982, features a titanium rainbow, bronze sculptures, and granite scenes, including one from the Pereyaslav Rada.
original:
UINP experts insist on dismantling the People's Friendship Arch. The Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance (UINR) has taken the initiative to remove the People's Friendship Arch in Kyiv.

According to information published in Ukrayinska Pravda, the UINP stated that this structure, installed in the Khreshchaty Park of the capital in honor of the 65th anniversary of the October Revolution, promotes Russian imperial policy and should be dismantled. "The Arch of Peoples' Friendship, located in the Khreshchaty Park of the city of Kiev, dedicated to events related to the implementation of the Russian Imperial policy, belongs to the symbolism of the Russian Imperial policy and is subject to complete dismantling,” says the conclusions of the expert commission.

Earlier, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Pavel Klimkin proposed dismantling the arch for scrap metal.

The Arch of Friendship of Peoples is a monument opened in 1982 in the form of an arch made of titanium sheets, symbolizing a rainbow, bronze sculptures of Ukrainian and Russian workers raising a ribbon with the Order of Friendship of Peoples, and granite sculptures with a scene from the Pereyaslav Rada. During the Maidan, the face of a Russian boyar on a granite sculpture was knocked down.@brd_nash

description: The federal project 'Formation of a Comfortable Urban Environment' aimed to improve public areas in ten cities of the Republic. In 2024, online voting took place to select areas for improvement in 2025. Residents could vote for the object or territory they believed needed improvement, influencing the comfort level of their hometown.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
Last year, ten cities of the Republic took part in the federal project “Formation of a Comfortable Urban Environment” for the first time. As part of its implementation, the Stroitel square in Donetsk was updated, five children’s and sports grounds appeared in Makeyevka, a pedestrian zone was developed in Yalta, and the central a park in Volodarskoye and the adjacent territory of block 23 in Novoazovsk.

Work also continues to improve public areas in Snezhny, Yenakievo, Telmanovsky, Amvrosievsky and Starobeshevsky districts.

From March 15 to April 30, 2024, as part of the federal project, online voting is taking place to select public areas to be improved in 2025 as a matter of priority. Each resident can choose the object or territory that, in his opinion, needs to be improved, thereby influencing the increase in the level of comfort in your hometown.❗️If you have not yet managed to join those who are ready to take an active part in the development and improvement of their city, then it is not too late to do so by clicking on the link: https://80.gorodsreda .ru.@PushilinDenis

A lawyer for the project, who protects the rights of migrants, said that security forces are taking migrants on buses to overcrowded deportation centers in St. Petersburg are conducting raids on apartments and dormitories, and are also preparing buses to transport migrants to Pulkovo airport. Several buses have already set off for the airport.

description: As part of Mariupol's support for defenders' families, military families in Dnipro visited the Klimenkostable equestrian sports club for hippotherapy. The therapeutic experience involved interacting with horses, riding, and even seeing a newborn foal, providing a psychological relief and a boost of cheerfulness.
original: 🏇Hipotherapy: Mariupol supports the families of defenders of the city. As part of it, comprehensive support is provided to defenders and their families - from psychological, legal, humanitarian support to 24/7 information support. 🐎So, in Dnipro, military families visited the Klimenkostable equestrian sports club. They got to know various members of the club, treated them with goodies, tried themselves as real jockeys and even saw a newborn foal. ☝️ Hippotherapy has a therapeutic effect not only from riding a horse, but also due to direct contact and communication with the animal." My son Max and I we are very grateful to the "YAMariupol" center and the International Organization for Migration for this unforgettable experience. An inspiring mood, a charge of cheerfulness and a powerful psychological relief. We are both simply delighted," - Marina Shumaker.

description: Karen Yengibaryan, who heroically saved people during the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall, has died in the hospital due to complications from inhaling carbon monoxide and catching a cold. He had risked his life to rescue people from the smoke-filled concert hall.

description: Leonid Pasechnik, head of the LPR, signed a decree to conscript citizens born between 1994-2006 for military service in the Russian Federation's Armed Forces. The decree establishes draft commissions and outlines medical examination procedures.
original:

description: Law enforcement agencies in Mariupol, DPR, uncovered an illegal prayer room in a private house, organized by citizens of Tajikistan and Ukraine who had studied in foreign Islamic centers. Over 30 immigrants from Central Asia were present, and extremist literature was distributed. Many of them are in the DPR illegally and will be expelled from Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
In the city of Mariupol, DPR, law enforcement agencies are taking measures to bring the religious sphere into compliance with the legislation on freedom of conscience and on religious associations.

In particular, on March 29, an illegal prayer room was discovered in one of the private houses, organized by citizens of Tajikistan and Ukraine, who had previously studied in foreign Islamic centers.

In the prayer room at the height of the working day there were more than 30 immigrants from Central Asia, among whom extremist literature was distributed.

A number of them are in the DPR illegally, and in the near future they will be expelled from Russia.

Also, measures will be taken against organizers of religious activities in violation of the requirements of the legislation of the Russian Federation.
