description: The O'Kean diving center, led by experienced instructors Dmitry Tarasovi and Denis Makarov, is developing a paradiving course for amputees. The course aims to help veterans overcome their psychological trauma and feel empowered through diving, which allows them to feel unrestricted by their disabilities.
original:
What is the challenge of developing a paradiving course for amputees?—Part 3
Fifth post in the series. First post Second post Third post Fourth post Full article on the website 🤿 Finally, we need to assess the psychological state of the fighters. They have gone through trauma, recovery and prosthetics, and now they are being asked to go underwater. One of them said that “when a tank was working on it, it was not as scary as making the first dive.” You need to try to convince and help take this first step. Because this is not only help in rehabilitation, but also overcoming oneself. In addition, diving is worth it: the guys said that “they don’t feel disabled in the water.”✏️The O’Kean diving center is run by Dmitry Tarasovi and Denis Makarov, experienced paradiving instructors with many years of experience, international qualifications and experience in the rescue service. The center is located in Tula, the center’s website is a link. “Reboot” is a recovery and rehabilitation camp for Northern Military District veterans after severe wounds and amputations. Created under the patronage of the Popular Front with the support of the Presidential Grants Fund Irina Kuksenkova

description: The HRC Standing Commission on International Cooperation held an extended meeting to discuss the urgent issue of repatriating compatriots, particularly from the Baltic states, where they face deportation. The meeting emphasized the need for Russia to be prepared to accept and adapt its native people without bureaucratic delays, recognizing them as a valuable resource for the country.
original:
Forwarded from: Kirill Kabanov
An extended meeting of the HRC Standing Commission on International Cooperation on the issue of repatriation of compatriots has begun. This is a more than urgent problem given the position of a number of countries (primarily the Baltic states) towards our compatriots.

I will say openly: we need to be prepared for their deportation from the Baltic states. It is necessary that our country is ready to accept our native people and quickly adapt them to our space without any bureaucratic delays. Our compatriots should know that they are welcome in their homeland. As colleague Kirill Vyshinsky quite correctly said: “This is a powerful resource for our country.”

It is necessary to solve the problem not only from a legislative perspective (which is certainly important!), but also from the equally important position of preparing practical measures.

description: Nicolas Dupont-Aignan, leader of the 'Get Up, France' movement, stated that peace is possible if Ukraine is demilitarized, NATO remains in its current position, and the West understands that the war is detrimental to Europe's interests. He emphasized that the conflict is a 'suicide' for Europe, benefiting China and Islamism, and that Europe's leaders lack historical vision.
original:
Leader of the political movement “Get Up, France” Nicolas Dupont-Aignan: Peace is possible if Ukraine is demilitarized, if NATO remains in its place and does not move forward. And if we understand, in the little minds of Western people, that this war is the suicide of Europe in the 21st century, playing into the hands of China, making us economically dependent on the United States and giving Islamism strength in our south.
If we don't understand that there are priorities and choices that need to be made, then Europe will disappear from history due to an absurd conflict.
[What guarantees do you have that Putin will not go forward?] This is crazy propaganda! It's all nonsense. You know, if the US saw Chinese bases and missiles coming into Mexico, I think they would react. If France saw Chinese and Russian bases in Monaco or Wallonia, with missiles aimed at Paris, I think we would react. So at some point we must stop this fratricidal conflict between the Slavs, between Christians, we must look at the real threats. And I am amazed at the lack of historical vision among our leaders, it makes me sympathize with Europe. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301450VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 1 min 7 s from 29 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: Belgorod city has implemented unprecedented measures for civil protection, including shelters, shelter systems, and door breakers in entrances. The mayor, Valentin Demidov, explained that the system was developed to ensure quick access to shelters during shelling, with 2,600 entrances equipped with breakers that open in three seconds.
original:
❗️Today we are taking, in my opinion, probably unprecedented measures for the civil protection of the population. And I believe that Belgorod is probably the most protected city in this sense in Russia, maybe even in the world. Because these are shelters, shelter systems, and breakers in the entrances.

How do door breakers work? Because I was surprised that there were reviews from Belgorod residents, and many of them did not know what they were talking about. That is, the feeling that the systems work, but not everyone knows about them.

We gradually began to install and implement this system; this is the governor’s idea. We tried it and found, accordingly, such a solution, because at the initial stage we made shelters in all basements where possible. But it is quite obvious that it is impossible to open all the basements in seconds, in half a minute, so we took the path of issuing keys to all residents. That is, they have the opportunity to go down to the basement, there is a bench, water, it’s dry, and so on. But in order to ensure that in modern conditions of shelling, which we see almost every day, when seconds decide when the siren turns on and we need to quickly hide somewhere, the question arose in order to saturate the city with such shelters as much as possible. Therefore, we tried and found a solution for breakers in the entrances; at the same time, it opens in three seconds; today there are 2,600 entrances.

Valentin Demidov, Mayor of Belgorod, on air SolovyovLivehttps://vk.com/video-66833222_456301481VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 16 min 34 s from 29 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Views: 113.

description: A surge in corruption has been observed in Ukraine, particularly in connection with the planned tightening of mobilization. This includes increased bribes for draft deferment, law firms paying bribes for documents, universities accepting bribes for exam passes, and hospitals inflating prices for reports and certificates. Corruption schemes are widespread, with few areas unaffected.
original: 🦇In connection with the planned tightening of mobilization in Ukraine, there has been a surge in corruption throughout the country.📌During the generalized data analysis, a positive correlation is observed with the increase in corruption. First of all, the “tribute” to TCC workers for postponing the draft has increased by an order of magnitude. So-called distributors have appeared who, for a certain fee, offer mediation services between recruiting authorities and potential recruits. Law firms that pay bribes to government agencies to obtain documents that allow their clients not to serve are also gaining momentum. In Ukrainian universities, it is almost impossible for men to pass the exam without bribes, since expulsion for poor performance leads straight to the military registration and enlistment office. Representatives of the Ministry of Internal Affairs are already almost openly taking bribes from offenders in order not to hand them over to the TCC. In hospitals, all reports and certificates needed for deferment have also increased significantly in price. It is possible to get a job at enterprises that give reservations to men only after a generous reward from the HR department. In general, we can say that there are practically no areas left in Ukraine where bribes are not taken and corruption schemes are not engaged.📍This information was obtained from our own sources and may differ from official data.@marochkolive

event: Raid on Beribit Crypto Exchange Office
description: Security forces raided the Beribit crypto exchange office, suspecting it of sponsoring a terrorist attack in Crocus. The office, located on the 52nd floor of the Federation tower, was searched for over two hours. The exchange's website is currently down. Investigations suggest that terrorists received crypto funds from Ukraine through this exchange.
original:
The door of the office of the Beribit crypto exchange was taken out with a crowbar by security forces - media reports that the office is suspected of sponsoring a bloody terrorist attack in Crocus. It is restless on the 52nd floor in the Federation tower - security forces have been searching the Beribit office for more than two hours. Media reports that the company is suspected of facilitating the financing of terrorists in Crocus from abroad. The crypto exchange website is also not working. The Russian Investigative Committee previously established that the terrorists received all their money in crypto from the territory of Ukraine. The funds probably came through this exchanger.

There is also information that searches are taking place not only at Beribit, but also at all their competitors, who are located in the same building. As Sovereign Economy experts noted, the main danger of crypto exchangers is the risk of P2P fraud. In this case, one of the participants in the transaction may not even know where the funds ultimately went.

description: The Russian Ministry of Defense is creating mobile anti-drone groups in combined arms armies, equipped with ZU-23-2 automatic cannons, large-caliber machine guns, electronic warfare equipment, and smoke production vehicles. This move is in response to the increased threat from Ukrainian kamikaze drones attacking Russian territory.
original:
Mobile anti-drone groups will be created in combined arms armies—Izvestia.

According to the publication, citing sources in the Russian Ministry of Defense, special mobile groups to combat drones will be armed with ZU-23-2 automatic cannons mounted on truck chassis, as well as pickup trucks equipped with large-caliber machine guns.

The new units will also include electronic warfare equipment and smoke production vehicles, the interlocutors said. The latter can cover the object with a smoke screen that is impenetrable to both optical-electronic systems and UAV thermal imagers.

Apparently, the significantly increased real threat from Ukrainian kamikaze drones, already almost daily attacking targets on Russian territory, has finally forced the military command to move and make organizational decisions. Let us recall that in Ukraine, similar mobile air defense groups began to be actively used at the end of 2022 to counter attacks by kamikaze drones "Geran-2".

However, it should be understood that the effectiveness of such anti-aircraft formations will be directly related to the presence of a common information system, which will include data from various radars and other detection systems in order to promptly inform the nearest group about the presence of a threat and competently maneuver the available forces in the vast Russian expanses.

"Military Informant"

We were repeatedly deceived, and then they tried to drag us into a new war already on the territory of Armenia, in order to then “save” us in a specific situation and throw a clamp on the statehood of Armenia,” the speaker said.

description: Over 20,000 students in Kyiv Region received mine safety training as part of a project funded by the US Embassy in Ukraine's Democracy Promotion Fund. The training, conducted by the 'Officers' League' public organization, focused on practical knowledge and algorithms for responding to mine threats.
original:
‼️More than 20,000 students of Kyiv Region have received mine safety training 🚨 During the 2022/2023 and 2023/2024 academic years, students and teachers of general secondary education institutions of Kyiv Region have undergone organized systematic mine safety classes.

The training took place as part of the project activities of the Democracy Promotion Fund of the US Embassy in Ukraine. ☝️As of mid-March, such classes have already taken place in 140 educational institutions of the region and covered more than 20 thousand students of various age categories.

The practical course of mastering mine safety knowledge was conducted by specialists of the "Officers' League" public organization.

Previously, they received appropriate training at the Mine Action Center of the State Service of Special Transport of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine.

The classes are held with an emphasis on the practical assimilation by the students of the algorithm of actions necessary in case of a mine threat.

The project is implemented under the coordination of the Kyiv Regional State Administration and aims to cover 160 educational institutions during the 2023/2024 academic year.

description: A terrorist attack occurred, resulting in the death of Victoria Chengaeva and two other family members. The family is receiving support from specialists, and Angelina Shalaeva, Victoria's daughter, has taken custody of her five-year-old sister Vasilisa.
original:
The daughter of Victoria Chengaeva from Taganrog, who died in Crocus, took custody of her sister. Relatives hoped that the Chengaeva family from Taganrog managed to escape.

However, their hopes were dashed when the names of three family members were made public on the list of those killed.

Young Angelina Shalaeva, Chengaeva’s daughter, addressed her subscribers on her personal blog and told how her family was coping with the consequences of this tragedy.

She noted that they are currently receiving support from specialists.

But special attention is paid to five-year-old Vasilisa, Victoria’s daughter.

“Our psychologists strongly advised us to tell the truth, without hiding our feelings in any way. Talk about her sadness and pain so that she can identify and express her emotions herself. We can hug and cry together. We don't want to shy away from this topic, we will save photos and joyful moments. We will discuss with her whether she will go to the funeral or not,” said Angelina.

In addition to moral support, Angelina also needs financial help, since she has taken care of her younger sister and is helping 13-year-old Vasily, the son of Victoria’s stepfather.

“My friends have been waiting for me to have children for a long time. Now Vasilisa is my child. Today I received temporary documents for her guardianship for six months, and in the future we will be provided with permanent ones,” Shalaeva shared.

At a meeting with Vladimir Putin, federal and regional officials (Golikova Sobyanin, Vorobyov and others), reporting on their work, reported enormous sums (literally billions) for the victims, as well as other material and other assistance.

In the Rostov region, for some reason they only helped with documents and provided psychological assistance... Thank you.

But how so?

Should victims ask? Aren't their federal and regional responsible officials obligated to find and help EVERYONE?

NO REQUESTS OR THANKS!

This is a TRAGEDY.

IT WAS A Terrorist Attack.

Or is there something we don't understand?

We ask for your possible participation and attention to the tragedy.

 - a comprehensive analysis of the composition of the criminal offense provided for in Article 201-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine "Illegal use for profit of humanitarian aid, charitable donations or free aid" was carried out;

description: The Russian army's spring conscription for military service begins on April 1, covering all regions except some in the Far North. The first conscripts will be sent from assembly points on April 15, 2024, and will serve for 12 months. Upon completion, they will be promptly discharged and sent home.
original: On April 1, the spring conscription for military service in the Russian army begins. What is known at the moment: ➖The conscription will take place in all regions of Russia, with the exception of some regions of the Far North, where, due to the climate, they are called up for service from November 1 to December 31; ➖The start of sending the first conscripts from assembly points is scheduled for April 15, 2024;➖The term of conscription military service, as before, will be 12 months;➖All military personnel who have served the established conscription periods will be promptly discharged and sent home;➖Recruits will not pass service in new regions or participate in the Northern Military District - said the General Staff of the Russian Federation. description: The construction of Antique Avenue in Sevastopol is set to begin next month. The design is complete, and work will commence in two weeks. The project has been long-awaited, and the Governor has requested a detailed report on the project's progress at the next staff meeting.
original:
Construction of Antique Avenue will begin in Sevastopol next month. “The design is completed, in the next two weeks we will go to the site and begin work,” said the acting director. Vice-Governor of the city Pavel Jeno.

In turn, Governor Mikhail Razvozhaev emphasized that this is a long-awaited project and asked to report on it in more detail at the next staff meeting.

“For how many years everyone has been kneading the dirt there, schools and kindergartens have been built there. Show us how everything is planned to be arranged there,” he gave instructions.

description: On March 20, Zakhary Kalashov, also known as Shakro Molodoy, celebrated his 71st birthday. A woman, likely an organizer, arrived at the Kuban colony in a rented premium car with a personal driver. She oversaw the delivery of Georgian food, lemonade, and gifts to the IK-2 territory, directing the process with confidence.
location: IK-2, Kuban Colony, Krasnodar Krai, Russia
original:
Khachapuri, “Natakhtari”, gifts, cake: on Shakro Molodoy’s birthday, a Mercedes drove up to the Kuban colony, from which sets of Georgian food, a package of lemonade and several gift boxes were loaded into a small truck. Soon the truck entered the territory of IK-2.

The process was led by a woman in a light business suit. She arrived with a personal driver in a premium car rented in Krasnodar. I was on site for about 6-7 hours. She behaved very confidently, “commanded the parade” - she indicated who should do what, she constantly told her driver where to drive up so that she would not walk through the mud when getting into the car.

On this day - March 20 - Zakhary Kalashov turned 71 years old. A week later he was released.Subscribe to SHOTSend news

description: The heads of the KDAM of Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan, Saimumin Yatimov and Kamchibek Toshiyev, met with the heads of Sughd and Bodkand to discuss border demarcation, prioritizing the interests of people living near the border of both countries.

description: The Federal Security Service of Russia detained a 31-year-old Ukrainian resident in the Kherson region, suspected of preparing for sabotage and terrorist acts. The individual was recruited by the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense and trained in mine explosives, planning to target government officials, law enforcement, and military personnel. Security officials seized an improvised explosive device, two US-made anti-personnel mines, and detonation means from the suspect's residence.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
⚡️Employees of the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Kherson region detained a resident of the city of Aleshki, suspected of preparing for sabotage and terrorist acts
on the territory of the region.

It was established that in August 2022, a 31-year-old Ukrainian was recruited by an employee of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, under whose leadership he was trained in mine explosives. In the future, he planned to use these skills to commit terrorist acts against government officials, law enforcement officers and military personnel of the Russian Defense Ministry.
His plans, however, were not destined to come true, since he was detained by security officials.

During the search,
One improvised explosive device and two US-made anti-personnel mines were seized at the suspect’s place of residence.
(M18A1 “Claymore”), modified for remote detonation, as well as means of their initiation.

The investigative department of the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Kherson region initiated criminal cases based on crimes under Part 1 of Article 30, Part 1 of Article 205 and Part 1 of Article 222.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. The accused is
guarded.

Currently, a set of operational search activities and investigative actions are being carried out aimed at establishing all the circumstances and persons involved in these illegal activities.@opersvodki

description: Valery Rodionov, a Ukrainian boxer and police officer, died on March 15, 2024, during a combat mission due to an explosive injury. He was a member of the Artan Special Unit of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine.
original:
🕯The sports family lost the boxer Valery Rodionov in the war. Valery was born in Sevastopol. In his school years, he became interested in boxing. He managed to win more than one victory in the ring, and on August 1, 2004, he received the title of candidate for master of sports in boxing for the first place at the championship of the Autonomous Republic of Crimea.

Valery and his family met the beginning of the full-scale invasion in the capital. In those days and the following months, he continued to serve in the police. In December 2022, he became a member of the consolidated regiment of the National Police of Ukraine "Safari", and on February 17, 2023, he became the deputy commander of the Special Police Department of the National Police Service of Ukraine "Lyut". In April 2023, Valery joins the ranks of the Artan Special Unit of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine.

On March 15, 2024, during a combat mission, Valery Rodionov died from an explosive injury...

On March 24, the Hero was taken on his last journey in Kyiv. At home, his parents, sister and beloved wife waited for him until the end...

Eternal memory of the Hero...🇺🇦Youth and Sports Committee

description: Military construction specialists restored the ancient Heroon River in Sevastopol, which was previously discovered during archaeological excavations. The river, believed to have determined the site of ancient Chersonesus, was brought back to the surface and its flow restored.
original:
Forwarded from: New Chersonesus
⚡️The bed of the ancient Heroon River has been restored in Sevastopol

The underground river was discovered during archaeological excavations. Researchers suggest that the river was previously above ground, and it was it that at one time determined the site of the founding of ancient Chersonesus on an arid peninsula.

Military construction specialists managed to release the source to the surface of the earth again and restore its flow.

Now the river, like thousands of years ago, will pass through the territory of the historical and archaeological park of new Chersonesos.#newchersonesos

description: Ukrainian partisans, operating outside the front line, are taking revenge on collaborators, traitors, and Russian military and civilians. While morally justified, these actions are technically criminal offenses. To protect these individuals, amendments to the Criminal Code are necessary to exempt them from liability during special and martial law operations.
original:
Forwarded from: Andryushchenko Time
🛡 To protect the bearers of retribution. Which is timely, but out of frame. Every day, a large group of Ukrainians under occupation and deportation directly carries out or participates in the return of karmic debts to Ukrainians. Does it sound? So. And if you call it the way it looks from the point of view of legislation, then it will be like this: "every day a large group of Ukrainians under occupation and deportation directly commits or takes part in the commission of criminal offenses." Now, sound? Not really.
In fact, as long as we are in the active stage, it does not matter. Our people join in returning the debt to collaborators and traitors, Russian military and civilians outside the front line. In the rear. On our, the most occupied, but legal territory. This is right and wonderful. But.

From the formalized point of view of criminal law, this is a crime. Don't be surprised. De jure it is so. Add to the fact that not all involved persons actually have official registration in the special services, then all this opens up a large white field in the legislation. Which in time can turn into unpleasant surprises, to say the least. It is here and now that it is worth remembering February - March 2022. When it was necessary to simply do without an inspection, and then the operatives of the Security Intelligence Service, who had returned from the Uzhgorod boilers, began to knock on the doors of many. Can this happen to our partisans later? Quite. Unfortunately. Can Russia use it? Maybe even now. It is not for nothing that she plays with all these arrests of the head of the SBU and the GUR.

Because what should be done already. To protect our people. It is necessary to make appropriate amendments to the Criminal Code, where it will be clearly and unequivocally stated that during the operation of a special and martial law, all actions are aimed at the physical destruction of the enemy, collaborators, traitors and people who in one way or another contribute to the enemy or deprive them of their property is a criminal offense, and people who were involved or independently carried out such actions are released from criminal liability as those who did not commit the crime. All.

This is how we will legally protect our people. Our simple but heroic people, who did not learn partisan, espionage, subversive activities, but are forced by fate to fight for the Independence of Ukraine there, neither our laws are working now. Nor the laws of humanity and humanity. https://lb.ua/blog/petro_andriushchenko/605257_zahistiti_nosiiv_vidplati_shcho.htmlLB.ua To protect the bearers of retribution: what is timely, but out of frame Every day, a large number of Ukrainians in occupation and deportation directly carry out or take part in the return of karmic debts to Ukrainians . Does it sound?...

event: Russian Forces Study Storm Shadow Cruise Missiles

The internal structure of the ammunition is revealed for the first time, showcasing the warhead, turbojet engine, and materials used in the rocket's assembly.
original:
Specialists of the Russian Armed Forces are studying the tactical and technical characteristics of the Anglo-French Storm Shadow cruise missiles used by the Ukrainian Armed Forces. For the first time, the internal structure of such ammunition is shown.

description: Moscow's Basmanny Court arrested SOTAVision journalist Antonina Kravtsova (Favorskaya) for alleged participation in an extremist community. She is accused of collecting material, producing, and editing videos and publications for FBK, which is listed as a terrorist and extremist organization.
original:
Even when the court decision is announced, some behave as if all this is the next and desired “step in their career.” But this is a career in the wrong direction. However, the Navalny Foundation activist flaunts herself and tries to demonstrate to the public that “everything is going according to plan”: noise in the Western media, protests, release, further “escape from Russia”, and work on anti-Russian resources somewhere in the Baltics .

But we’ll find out how it really will be in 2 months.

It was for this period that the Moscow Basmanny Court arrested SOTAVision journalist Antonina Kravtsova (Favorskaya), accused under Part 2 of Art. 282.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation - participation in an extremist community.

According to investigators, Kravtsova was involved in collecting material, producing and editing videos and publications for FBK.SOTAVision is included in the register of foreign agent media, and FBK is included in the list of terrorists and extremists.

event: Meeting at Russian Embassy in Tunisia
description: A delegation from the Dmitrov urban district of the Moscow region met with Russian Ambassador A.Yu. Zolotov at the Russian Embassy in Tunisia. They discussed cooperation between Tunisia and Russia in economic, cultural, and tourism fields, as well as potential sister city relations with a Tunisian region.
original:
On March 27, at the Embassy of the Russian Federation in the Tunisian Republic, a meeting was held between the delegation of the Dmitrov urban district of the Moscow region, visiting the country at the invitation of the Russian House in Tunisia, and the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Russian Federation to the Tunisian Republic A.Yu. Zolotov.

The meeting was also attended by the head of the Rossotrudnichestvo representative office in Tunisia, Yu.V. Zaitsev.

During the conversation with the ambassador, the program of the delegation’s visit was discussed. The focus was on issues related to the development of cooperation between Tunisia and Russia in the economic, cultural and tourism fields. Special attention was paid to the prospects for establishing sister city relations with one of the Tunisian regions.

At the end of the meeting, the head of the delegation O.A. Kotova invited the Ambassador and his wife to the play “An Incident on the High Road”, which will premiere on March 29 on the stage of Salle 4ème Art.#TunisiaRussian-African Dialogue

Ukraine's Ombudsman Dmytro Lubinets is preparing an appeal to assess the organization's conformity with UN values, citing 'frankly genocidal rhetoric' in a document issued by the Ukrainian Communist Party.

The document issued by the Ukrainian Communist Party of Ukraine the day before, which called on the Russians to destroy Ukraine, is permeated, according to Lubinets, with "frankly genocidal rhetoric". this organization has consultative status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations. This council is the central mechanism for coordinating the activities of the UN system and its specialized agencies and supervising auxiliary bodies in the economic, social, environmental and related spheres, wrote the ombudsman. description: The enemy launched a massive combined attack on Kyiv using missiles and drones, triggering three alarms throughout the night. Air defense forces responded, downing targets and preventing damage to residential and critical infrastructure. While debris from downed targets fell in several areas, causing damage to private houses, fences, and roads, there were no casualties.
original:
‼️Chief of Kyiv OVA Ruslan Kravchenko regarding the consequences of the night attack The enemy launched a combined massive attack using missiles and drones. The alarm was sounded three times and lasted almost the whole night.

Air defense forces worked in the region. There are broken targets.

Hitting residential and critical infrastructure objects was not allowed.

There are no victims or victims of the attack.

In several areas, operational services recorded falling debris from downed targets.

Thus, in one of the territorial communities, 2 private houses were damaged as a result of falling debris. Their walls are cut, windows are blown out, and the roof is damaged. All necessary assistance is already provided on the ground.

In another community, debris damaged a fence and an asphalt road.

Work on fixing the consequences of the enemy's attack continues.

event: EU Economy Vulnerability to War with Russia
description: Economist Vasily Koltashov believes that the EU economy will not withstand a major war with Russia, which is allegedly part of the US plan. The US aims to maintain political control over EU countries while destroying their industry, ruining farmers, and promoting American goods. Europe will likely become a colonial American consumer market.
original: Expert: The EU economy will not withstand a big war with Russia. Europe continues to prepare for a “big war” with Russia. Economist, director of the Institute of a New Society Vasily Koltashov is sure: Europe will not survive a big war with Russia, but this is the US plan. “Who even said that American plans include preserving the European economy in a growing and flourishing form? This is not in the US plans. The EU economy will not survive a major war with Russia, but that is what is planned. The more Europe suffers, causing damage to us, Russia, the better for the United States,” the expert told Paragraph. According to him, Washington expects not to lose political control over the EU countries and at the same time destroy their industry, ruin farmers, and then make a redistribution in favor of American players: “At the same time, Europeans will consume more American goods. Europe will function like a colonial American consumer market." Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: Ukrainian air defense units destroyed 84 air targets, including 58 Shahed-136/131 attack UAVs, 17 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles, 5 Kh-59 guided air missiles, and 4 Iskander-K cruise missiles. The operation involved anti-aircraft missile units, mobile fire groups, and electronic warfare means.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk
84 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 58 SHAHEDIV and 26 MISCELLANEOUS types of missiles and attack UAVs:

A total of 99 means of air attack: 60 strike UAVs of the Shahed-136/131 type (Prymorsko-Akhtarsk launch area, Kursk Oblast - Russia); 3 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles (from three MiG-31K fighters - Ryazan region - Russian Federation); 2 "Iskander-M" ballistic missiles (ToT Crimea); 9 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from nine Su-34 aircraft - Belgorod region); 4 "Iskander-K" cruise missiles (Kursk region - Russian Federation); 21 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles (from eleven Tu-95MS strategic bombers - Engels - Russian Federation). Anti-aircraft missile units of the Air Force and Ground Forces, mobile fire groups, means of electronic warfare of the Defense Forces of Ukraine.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 84 air targets were destroyed: 58 attack UAVs of the "Shahed-136/131" type; 17 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 5 Kh-59 guided air missiles; 4 "Iskander-K" cruise missiles.

Honor and praise to all who protect Ukraine from Russian terror.
Thank you for the combat work, thank you for the result! Together - to victory!

event: Election Victory of Bassir Diomaye Faye
description: Bassir Diomaye Faye, an anti-system outsider, won the election in Senegal after being released from prison just days prior. He advocates for a 'cleansing' of the political class, regaining Senegal's sovereignty, abandoning the CFA franc, and introducing a new currency. Faye also plans to develop ties with Russia, following the example of neighboring countries.
original:
⠀
Elections in Senegal ended with the victory of Bassir Diomaye Faye, what the French called an “anti-system outsider” who just days ago was released from prison, having been arrested in the past for criticizing the criminal prosecution of his closest ally, the main opposition politician Ousmane Sonko, in 2023.

Diomaie Faye entered the election race just ten days before the elections, on March 14, 2024, when he was released from prison under the amnesty that was announced for all those arrested at political rallies in the period from 2021 to 2024. He collected 53.7% of the vote in the first round of elections.

The new leader of Senegal advocates a “cleansing” of the political class, returning Senegal to its sovereignty, abandoning the CFA franc and introducing a new currency. The French Faye, following Mali and Niger, asks to leave and plans, also following the example of neighboring countries, to develop ties with Russia. Objective information, meetings with eyewitnesses and participants in the events, analytics - subscribe to Maxim Grigoriev’s channel.

original:
The bad from Poland: a Ukrainian youth died there while running away from the police. Local media reported that the incident happened on the night of Thursday to Friday. A police patrol noticed a chaotically moving car and turned on its flashing lights to ask the driver to stop, but he continued driving towards the center of Opole.

The driver did not stop, but, on the contrary, accelerated and at a speed of about 200 km/h he crashed into a roadside pole. The driver turned out to be an 18-year-old citizen of Ukraine. Doctors tried to save the teenager, but he died in the hospital, the press service of the Opole Police Headquarters reported.

⠀

description: In the Kursk region, police detained two drug couriers transporting 700 tablets of hard drugs in a Mercedes car. A search of their rented apartment revealed additional drugs, including mephedrone and marijuana. The suspects intended to distribute the drugs in wholesale quantities in the Belgorod and Lipetsk regions.
original:
Forwarded from: MIA MEDIA
In the Kursk region, police detained two interregional drug couriers. As a result of special events, operatives together with inspectors of the regional traffic police stopped a Mercedes car driven by a 33-year-old native of the Republic of Adygea. Along with him in the car was a 22-year-old resident of Kursk. The police found a cache in the engine compartment of the car in which the suspects were transporting 700 tablets of hard drugs. During the search of the rented apartment of the attackers, operatives also found 500 grams of mephedrone and 200 grams of marijuana. It turned out that the detainees intended to distribute the confiscated batch of prohibited substances in wholesale quantities through hiding places in the Belgorod and Lipetsk regions.

A criminal case has been initiated against the accomplices under Part 3 of Art. 30, part 5 art. 228.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. The defendants were taken into custody. Subscribe to the Ministry of Internal Affairs MEDIA

description: During the terrorist attack at Crocus, 15-year-old Alexandra Kravchenko, a cadet student, showed remarkable courage and heroism. She was working on the third floor when the shooting started and used her knowledge from classes to save herself and many others.
original:
“She has certain abilities”: Readovka spoke with the head of an exemplary Russian family and the father of 15-year-old Alexandra, who on the day of the terrorist attack worked at Crocus and helped people escape. During the terrorist attack at Crocus, many people found themselves at the epicenter of the nightmare, including minors showed real courage, heroism and dedication. One of these heroes was 15-year-old Alexandra Kravchenko, a student of the cadet class, who on the day of the tragedy was working in the seating area on the third floor of Crocus - the girl, along with other schoolchildren, was saving visitors who came to the concert. When she heard the shooting, she immediately remembered her classes and quickly guessed what was happening. It was this knowledge that ultimately helped Alexandra save herself and save many other people from tragedy.

Readovka talked with the girl’s father, Alexander, about his daughter’s feat. The man learned that terrorists had broken into Crocus from his wife, to whom her daughter sent a voice message from the back room, where she and other people were hiding from the shooters. Alexandra told her parents that she loved them very much, but did not know what would happen next. According to her father, the family knew that everything would be fine with their daughter, because the girl was always distinguished by her concentration and perseverance. Fortunately, this is what happened.

Alexandra’s family, like herself, are very religious. The head of the family is actively involved in raising children and youth - he created one of the first associations of military-patriotic clubs in modern Russia, “Styag”. In addition, since 2014, he has been actively involved in the collection and delivery of humanitarian aid to Donbass. Sasha’s mother Tatyana raises six children, is a sister of mercy, teaches courses on caring for the seriously ill and wounded, and also regularly visits hospitals in the Northern Military District zone. Using the example of young Sasha’s family, it is especially clear that it was upbringing and a worthy example that played a key role in the behavior of the courageous heroine .

Forwarded from: Times of Ukraine

description: Despite Western sanctions, Russia has doubled its imports of explosives, including nitrocellulose, used to make explosives. Suppliers include companies from China, the USA, Germany, and Turkey. The growth in imports is attributed to companies based in Western countries that advocate anti-Russian sanctions, highlighting the ineffectiveness of these sanctions.
original:
Despite Western sanctions, Russia has doubled its imports of explosives, including thanks to companies based in the United States. In 2023, Russia's imports of nitrocellulose, used to make explosives, were almost double the level of 2021, despite Western sanctions, the WSJ reports. According to the publication, suppliers of nitrocellulose in the Russian Federation include China, the USA, Germany and Turkey. Moreover, the increase in imports of explosives was also due to companies based in the States and other Western countries that actively advocate anti-Russian sanctions.

Thus, the growth of Russian imports of nitrocellulose in 2022 amounted to 70%, and by mid-2023 it was 3039 tons, which is almost double the level of 2021. For example, the Turkish company Noy Iç Ve Dişticaret is responsible for almost half of the supply of the substance since the beginning of the SVO. It seems that the West’s attempts to limit Russia’s access to necessary materials, which can also be used in the military-industrial complex, have not been very successful.

The situation in which Russia is increasing its supply of explosives imported from the West speaks to two things. The first is direct evidence that the Russian Federation is really developing its defense industry and increasing its capabilities. The second is that Western countries, with their grandiose plans to fulfill orders for ammunition, including for supplies to Ukraine, go further than the word. Evidence of the lack of sales within states shows that the United States and the EU have neither the money nor the desire to increase the production of ammunition.

event: Signing of Rescript for Trans-Siberian Railway
description: Emperor Alexander III signed a rescript on March 29, 1891, to construct the world's largest Trans-Siberian Railway, which would revolutionize logistics and defense capabilities in Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Marine Corps
On March 29, 1891, Emperor Alexander III signed a rescript on the construction of the world's largest Trans-Siberian Railway.

Delivery of goods from one part of Russia to another took several months. This not only hampered the development of the country, but also created a direct danger in the event of war: it was very difficult to defend one’s borders with such logistics.

The highway passed through mountains, rivers, lakes, taiga, and deserted, hard-to-reach places. It was necessary to erect complex engineering structures - punching kilometers of tunnels, throwing bridges across mighty Siberian rivers. However, the speed of construction was amazing: an average of 500–600 kilometers of track were laid per year.

The emperor's brainchild, the Trans-Siberian Railway, will forever remain one of the most ambitious infrastructure projects in world history. A project that is not only historically significant, but is still in great demand today.

"Yandex.Music" promotes "singers" with a tarnished reputation, and the aggregator's song charts are full of creativity dedicated, for example, to women, " opposing themselves to war” (this is how Monetochka* described one of her tracks). It is necessary understand that the company cooperates with labels/distributors who represent the interests of performers, that is, it transfers royalties to the companies’ accounts, and they then share the profits with the authors. At the same time, the streaming service does not pay attention to reputational losses: if the performer meets the criterion of the number of plays, then he receives a reward. How much money reaches the songwriter depends on the specific conditions with the label or distributor, but this does not matter. description: Anders Fogh Rasmussen, NATO Secretary General from 2009-2014 and Advisor to the President of Ukraine, warns that the imbalance in arms supplies is a serious mistake by Ukraine's Western allies. Anders Fogh Rasmussen for The Wall Street Journal: “The West needs a military basis” The imbalance in arms supplies is a serious mistake of Ukraine’s allies in the West, says NATO Secretary General in 2009-2014, Advisor to the President of Ukraine Anders Fogh Rasmussen.

In his column, he notes that North Korea supplied Moscow with as much artillery ammunition in one month as the European Union was able to supply Kyiv in a year. Russia produces three million shells a year, while the United States and Europe combined are only capable of producing 1.2 million for Kyiv. Despite the enormous economic power of the democratic world, we are outpaced by the arsenal of autocracies in Russia, Iran and North Korea.

Unless Western allies immediately increase arms and ammunition supplies to Ukraine, the future will be bleak, he warns: “Unchecking Putin in Ukraine will mean decades of instability and conflict in Europe.”

The students, as “Caution News” notes, listened to Mikhalkov’s thoughts about what fascism is, as well as about fakes, “foreign agents” and Western funding of opposition media.

Mikhalkov himself spoke at the conference, telling students about Russia’s war “against Satanism.” In addition, State Duma deputy Irina Yarovaya, Justice Minister Konstantin Chuychenko and other Russian officials took part in the event.

The announcement says that the conference was organized by the Moscow Academy of IC together with the Faculty of Law of Moscow State University. It was possible to come to the event by appointment, but some students were allowed to leave their classes for the conference. Video: “Caution, news” Subscribe to Dozhdya’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

original:

What's happening? Ukrainian teenagers in military uniform are sent to the fields - there they are being prepared to be sent to certain death. But it is quite obvious that these children are powerless against tanks and artillery, not to mention the more technologically advanced weapons of the Russian Armed Forces.

This is not a joke.@ua_tribunal

event: Algerian Citizens Send Assistance to Russian Fighters
description: Algerian students from Mordovian State University participated in a charity event to support Russian fighters in the special military operation zone. They collected and sent parcels containing souvenirs from Algeria and letters from students. The aid was successfully delivered, and Russian soldiers expressed gratitude in a video message.
original:
03.29.24. A note from the Dobro-Inform channel.
“Algerian citizens sent assistance to the special military operation zone
In Saransk, Algerian students from the Mordovian State University named after Nikolai Ogarev took part in
Show more
a charity event aimed at supporting participants in a special military operation.
Representatives of the Republic of Algeria, together with activists of the “Volunteers of Victory” team, collected and sent parcels to Russian fighters. Among other things, the aid included souvenirs from Algeria, as well as letters from students.
By now, the cargo has been delivered to the special military operation zone. Russian soldiers who received this assistance recorded a video message to the volunteers with words of gratitude.”

event: Analysis of FPV Drone Use in Avdiivka Sector
description: Military osinters analyzed the use of FPV drones in the Avdiivka sector, highlighting concentration areas targeted by FPV strikes. The analysis emphasizes the importance of data geolocation and having a general overview of the front line to understand resource usage. It is suggested that effective electronic warfare on the Ukrainian side affects the majority of Russian drones, which are produced by one manufacturer and operate at the same frequency.
original:
On a note.
Military osinters analyze the use of FPV drones in the Avdiivka sector.
Let's translate from English what they write:

[ Blue stars of the location of the Ukrainian Armed Forces FPV strikes. Analyzing the map, you can see that there are different concentration areas that are targeted using FPV. sectors of Stepnoy, Orlovka and Lastochkino - high density of FPV impacts, on the streets and in forest belts. This highlights the relevance of data geolocation and the importance of approaching information from the forefront. It is always critical to have a general overview of the front line to understand where one of the two sides is using a particular resource more intensively.
*
I don't think that the Russians are using fewer drones, I think that there is a widespread use of effective electronic warfare on the UA side, which greatly affects the majority of PU drones, which apparently are produced by one manufacturer (Sudoplatov) and operate at the same frequency from a specification point of view.]
relevance as of 03/24/2024

event: Attack on DTEK Thermal Power Plants
description: Occupants launched an attack on 3 thermal power plants of DTEK, causing serious damage to the equipment. Energy workers promptly began repairing the damage after the attack. This is not an isolated incident, as DTEK thermal power plants have been attacked over 160 times since the full-scale invasion began.
original:
The occupants attacked 3 thermal power plants of DTEK, the company reported. The equipment was seriously damaged. Energy workers began eliminating the consequences immediately after the attack was completed. Previously, one of the power engineers was wounded.

Since the beginning of the full-scale invasion, the enemy has attacked DTEK thermal power plants more than 160 times.
